author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <adlerjohn> Offtopic: this might be a stupid question, but in [slash_validator](https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/v0.8.2/specs/core/0_beacon-chain.md#slash_validator) how are we guaranteed that the correct whistleblower is rewarded? Can't the block proposer just...pretend they're the whistleblower and get all the reward?

author: djrtwo
content: the block proposer for slashings is always the whistleblower. In more long term games in phase 1 that span across multiple blocks, the whistleblower is remembered and gets a reward in addition to the block proposer

author: djrtwo
content: the function was just made modular to be used in both cases

author: djrtwo
content: Note that in both uses of `slash_validator` in phase one, no whistleblower is provided

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <adlerjohn> Oh I see. So for non-interactive proofs the proposer and whistleblower are the same, and for interactive proofs they may be different, basically?

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content: I disagree with this. In my opinion, if there was a deserialization spec for the latest spec version, it definitely would have sped up our catching up to the latest spec.
